abstract.p: Letter from attorney Jerry H Goldfeder on Aug 2 article about nominating petition battles at New York City Board of Elections; advocates alternative means for access to ballot so that elections are open and democratic

block.p: An Aug. 4 letter refers to protesters in the battle to save the former home of Edgar Allan Poe as ''a few gadflies.'' These ''gadflies'' include growing ranks of scholars and preservationists from around the nation and the world. Yet New York University continues to wage its war of distortion and desecration, in spite of the fact that an increasing number of people consider this modest house to be a cultural and historic treasure worthy of national landmark status.
The writer is a preservationist on the Poe House Rally Committee.
